inclusion.criterion: Adult patients 18 years and older with histologically proven locally advanced stage
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: III or IV unresectable Squamous cell head and neck cancer SCCHN (including cancers of oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx and hypopharynx) with no evidence of distant metastasis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A careful evaluation for resection is required from the surgeon and criteria for unresectability carefully defined for individual primary sites as follows:
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patient who have had prior treatment for head and neck cancer
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Prior history of radiation to head and neck area
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma, but the current cancer is Squamous cell head and neck cancer. The patient's age is not mentioned, but it is assumed to be over 18 years old.
